Identification.LongTitle: Service of Documents Required or Authorized to be Served Under Sections 53 to 57 of the Conflict of Interest Act Regulations

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 54 of the Conflict of Interest Acta, hereby makes the annexed Service of Documents Required or Authorized To Be Served Under Sections 53 to 57 of the Conflict of Interest Act Regulations.

Subsection.Text: A document required or authorized to be served on a public office holder under sections 53 to 57 of the Conflict of Interest Act may be served

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: personally, by delivering a copy of it

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to the public office holder at any place, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the public office holder cannot conveniently be found, to a person who appears to be at least 18 years of age at the public office holder’s last known address or usual place of residence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by registered mail or courier to the public office holder’s last known address, usual place of residence or place of work; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: by electronic transmission, including by fax or e-mail, to the public office holder’s last known address, usual place of residence or place of work.

Subsection.MarginalNote: When a copy required to be sent by registered mail
Subsection.Text: If a document is served by electronic transmission, a copy of it shall also be sent by registered mail.

Section.Text: The date of service of a document is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the document is delivered personally, the day on which it is delivered;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the document is served by registered mail or by courier, the 10th day after the date indicated in the receipt issued to the sender by the postal or courier service, as the case may be; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the document is served by electronic transmission, the day on which it is sent.

Section.Text: Any of the following documents constitute proof of service:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an acknowledgment of service signed by or on behalf of the person served; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an affidavit of service stating the name of the person who served the document and the date, place and manner of service.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which section 54 of the Conflict of Interest Act as enacted by section 2 of Chapter 9 of the Statutes of Canada, 2006, comes into force or, if it is later, on the day on which they are registered.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Regulations in force July 9, 2007, see SI/2007-75.]
